Dialogue.NPCText:
A tall monk stands in the dappled forest shade, head bowed, hands resting atop a worn quarterstaff.

Bruk the Silent meets your gaze. He makes no sound—only a solemn nod, his eyes both wary and kind. A thin scar bisects his lips. You sense a quiet strength and deep sorrow.

He gestures for you to approach, palm raised in greeting.

Option.text: Speak: 'Do you have words for me, monk?'

Dialogue.NPCText:
Bruk inclines his head in return, then touches his heart and points to the grove behind him.
He draws a spiral in the earth with his staff—an ancient Verdant symbol for “trial” or “path.”

He gestures: Will you accept his silent challenge?

Bruk studies you thoughtfully. After a moment, he kneels and arranges three smooth stones before you:
• One stone is engraved with a leaf.
• One is marked with a droplet.
• The third bears a small flame.

He waits, watching to see which you choose.

Bruk shakes his head slowly and closes his eyes, as if in pain.
He traces a single line across his lips, then points to his chest—an unspoken apology.
He offers you his staff, inviting you to grasp it if you wish to understand his path.

Option.text: Grip his staff and focus quietly.

Dialogue.NPCText: Bruk bows his head in understanding, then returns to his silent vigil. Perhaps you will return when ready.

Bruk leads you to a small clearing.
Without words, he sets out a line of pebbles in three patterns:
Pattern 1: A perfect circle.
Pattern 2: A broken spiral.
Pattern 3: Three parallel lines.

He points to you—choose the pattern that best reflects your spirit.

Bruk smiles faintly, recognizing your peaceful intent.
He places his hand on your shoulder in silent blessing. A sense of unity fills you.
(You have gained Karma and Bruk’s quiet respect.)

Bruk nods gravely, understanding your acceptance of hardship.
He draws a spiral on your palm—a Verdant mark of endurance.
(You feel a surge of strength.)

Bruk bows deeply in recognition of your sense of duty.
He hands you a twig tied with grass—a token of Verdant service.
(You have gained Fame among the Verdant Tribes.)

Bruk studies you, patient and unjudging.
He re-gathers the stones and returns to meditation. Some paths are not chosen in haste.

Bruk nods approvingly, recognizing your harmony with nature.
He offers you a carved leaf talisman—its touch is cool and invigorating.

Bruk’s eyes brighten. He draws a gentle swirl in the earth, blessing your insight.
The air feels lighter, thoughts clearer. Intellect and calm guide you.
Bruk grips your forearm in approval. The mark of the flame burns bright within you—strength to face the storm ahead.
Bruk shrugs, understanding not all choices must be made. He gathers the stones and continues his vigil.

Closing your eyes, you see a memory through Bruk’s own mind:
A duel gone wrong. His brother falls. Silence, then endless remorse.
You awaken, feeling the monk’s vow as a heavy weight, but also his drive to protect.
Bruk offers you a silent nod—a bond forged in shared understanding.

Option.text: Place a hand over your heart in solidarity.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Bruk gestures to his own chest, then to yours—a pact between warrior and ally.
If you seek his aid as a bodyguard, return here and invoke the Verdant vow.
(You have unlocked Bruk as a hireable companion for future travels!)

Option.text: Bow deeply and return to the village.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Bruk looks at you for a long moment.
He kneels and draws a line of ash on the ground, then presses two fingers to his lips.

Slowly, he arranges items before you:
• A bone medallion
• A withered feather
• A fractured wooden mask

He invites you to touch one, each a symbol of memory.

Option.text: Refuse to pry into his past.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Bruk inhales sharply.
He traces a second spiral near the medallion, then spreads ash in the shape of two mirrored figures… one crumbling.

You feel a jolt—his brother, once a warrior beside him, was lost in a sparring accident that shattered Bruk’s will to speak.
You hear no words, but his grief is loud.

Option.text: Place your hand on the crumbling figure.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Bruk nods slowly.
He lifts the feather and lets it fall, then points to a scar on his chest.

In a vision, you glimpse Bruk during the Verdant “Night of Thorns”—defending the sacred groves alone against a corrupted forest beast.
He survived, but was marked forever.

Option.text: Clench your fists—he is stronger for it.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Bruk tenses. The mask once covered his face during his time of exile.

He sets the broken mask into the firepit beside him and watches the flames consume it.
His silence, his scars, his vow—all penance for something never fully shared.

But as the mask burns, he finally looks you in the eye.

Bruk seems relieved. Not all truths must be unburied.

He places his hand on his chest, acknowledging your restraint.
In silence, trust is sometimes louder than questions.

Option.text: Bow and return to the grove.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Bruk takes a small pendant of bark and wraps it in leather twine.
He hands it to you: a token of trust, and of shared memory.

You feel more attuned to the Verdant’s silent strength.
